CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The decomposition temperature ( T d ) of PffBB-n was determined by thermal gravimetric analysis ( TGA ). The results suggested that all polymers exhibited good thermal stability with Tdhigher than 350 °C ( Table 1 ) , indicating that these polymers are feasible for high - temperature device a Molecular weight of polymers determined by gel permeation chromatography , using polystyrene as the reference standard , 1,2,3trichlorobenzene as the eluent at 150 °C ( flow rate : 1 mL min -1 ; column set : 3 × PLgel Olexix 300 × 7.5 mm ). b The polydispersity index was calculated from : PDI = M w / M n . c Estimated from thermal gravimetric analysis with a ramp rate of 40 °C min -1 . Article fabrication. The physical properties of PffBB-n polymers are summarized in Table 1. Detailed synthetic procedures and TGA traces could be found in the Supporting Information ( SI ). Optical and Electrochemical Properties of Polymers. The UV - vis absorption spectra of PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) measured in chlorobenzene at different temperatures and in thin films are shown in Figure 1. It is clearly demonstrated that PffBB-n exhibits strong temperature - dependent aggregation behavior. In thin films , PffBB-n showed three major absorption bands with the high - energy absorption peaked at ∼ 430 nm and two overlapped and strong absorptions peaked at ∼ 620 and 680 nm. In solution , the first two absorption peaks blue - shift to 380-420 and 520-560 nm , respectively , and the third absorption is highly temperature - dependent which becomes a shoulder peak at high temperature. Therefore , the absorption band located in the high energy region was attributed to π-π* transitions , whereas the broad absorption at around 560 nm corresponded to the intramolecular charge transfer band and the long - wavelength absorption emerged at ∼ 680 nm was due to the polymer interchain stacking aggregation. This aggregation - induced absorption is temperature - sensitive in which the absorption decreases with the increase of temperature , resulting from polymer chain segregation at high temperature. The incorporation of an alkyl side chain can often render a better solubility of a polymer ; however , the long alkyl side chain can exert stronger alkyl-alkyl chain interactions that can give rise to a strong aggregation of polymer chains. As shown in Figure 1 , the aggregation ability / strength of PffBB-n polymers also enhanced with an increase in the size of the alkyl side chains ( from n = 10 to 16 ). Furthermore , this class of polymers exhibited solvent - dependent aggregation behavior in which chloroform and toluene often induced stronger aggregation ; on the other hand , chlorobenzene and dichlorobenzene induced moderate aggregation ( Figure S3 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PffBB-n: This is the name of the polymers under discussion.
2. Polystyrene: This is used as the reference standard in gel permeation chromatography.
3. 1,2,3trichlorobenzene: This is used as the eluent in gel permeation chromatography.
4. M w and M n: These are the weight-average molecular weight and number-average molecular weight, respectively.
5. PLgel Olexix: This is the name of the column set used in gel permeation chromatography.
6. TGA: This stands for Thermal Gravimetric Analysis, a technique used to determine the decomposition temperature of materials.
7. Tdhigher than 350 °C: This refers to the thermal stability threshold of the polymers.
8. Figure 1: This is a figure mentioned in the text.
9. PDI: This stands for Polydispersity Index, a measure of the distribution of molecular weights in a polymer sample.
10. Figure S3: This is a supporting figure mentioned in the text.
11. Chlorobenzene, toluene, chloroform, and dichlorobenzene: These are different solvents that exhibit different aggregation behaviors with the PffBB-n polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PffBB-n
2. Polystyrene
3. PLgel Olexix
4. Chlorobenzene
5. Toluene
6. Chloroform
7. Dichlorobenzene

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n |
| Polystyrene |
| PLgel Olexix |
| Chlorobenzene |
| Toluene |
| Chloroform |
| Dichlorobenzene |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The decomposition temperature ( T d ) of PffBB-n was determined by thermal gravimetric analysis ( TGA ). The results suggested that all polymers exhibited good thermal stability with Tdhigher than 350 °C ( Table 1 ) , indicating that these polymers are feasible for high - temperature device a Molecular weight of polymers determined by gel permeation chromatography , using polystyrene as the reference standard , 1,2,3trichlorobenzene as the eluent at 150 °C ( flow rate : 1 mL min -1 ; column set : 3 × PLgel Olexix 300 × 7.5 mm ). b The polydispersity index was calculated from : PDI = M w / M n . c Estimated from thermal gravimetric analysis with a ramp rate of 40 °C min -1 . Article fabrication. The physical properties of PffBB-n polymers are summarized in Table 1. Detailed synthetic procedures and TGA traces could be found in the Supporting Information ( SI ). Optical and Electrochemical Properties of Polymers. The UV - vis absorption spectra of PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) measured in chlorobenzene at different temperatures and in thin films are shown in Figure 1. It is clearly demonstrated that PffBB-n exhibits strong temperature - dependent aggregation behavior. In thin films , PffBB-n showed three major absorption bands with the high - energy absorption peaked at ∼ 430 nm and two overlapped and strong absorptions peaked at ∼ 620 and 680 nm. In solution , the first two absorption peaks blue - shift to 380-420 and 520-560 nm , respectively , and the third absorption is highly temperature - dependent which becomes a shoulder peak at high temperature. Therefore , the absorption band located in the high energy region was attributed to π-π* transitions , whereas the broad absorption at around 560 nm corresponded to the intramolecular charge transfer band and the long - wavelength absorption emerged at ∼ 680 nm was due to the polymer interchain stacking aggregation. This aggregation - induced absorption is temperature - sensitive in which the absorption decreases with the increase of temperature , resulting from polymer chain segregation at high temperature. The incorporation of an alkyl side chain can often render a better solubility of a polymer ; however , the long alkyl side chain can exert stronger alkyl-alkyl chain interactions that can give rise to a strong aggregation of polymer chains. As shown in Figure 1 , the aggregation ability / strength of PffBB-n polymers also enhanced with an increase in the size of the alkyl side chains ( from n = 10 to 16 ). Furthermore , this class of polymers exhibited solvent - dependent aggregation behavior in which chloroform and toluene often induced stronger aggregation ; on the other hand , chlorobenzene and dichlorobenzene induced moderate aggregation ( Figure S3 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Decomposition temperature (Td) of PffBB-n: The decomposition temperature is given in degrees Celsius (°C). The values are higher than 350°C for all polymers.
2. Molecular weight (Mw, Mn): The molecular weight is given in grams per mole (g/mol). The values are determined by gel permeation chromatography.
3. Polydispersity index (PDI): The polydispersity index is a dimensionless value. It is calculated by the ratio of weight-average molecular weight (Mw) to number-average molecular weight (Mn).
4. Flow rate: The flow rate is given in milliliters per minute (mL/min).
5. Column set dimensions: The column set dimensions are given in millimeters (mm).
6. Temperature (T) for UV-vis absorption spectra: The temperature is given in degrees Celsius (°C).
7. Absorption peaks in thin films: The absorption peaks are given in nanometers (nm).
8. Absorption peaks in solution: The absorption peaks are given in nanometers (nm).
9. Size of alkyl side chains (n): The size of alkyl side chains is given as a numerical value (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16).
10. Absorption band locations: The absorption band locations are given in nanometers (nm).
11. Ramp rate for TGA: The ramp rate is given in degrees Celsius per minute (°C/min).
12. Absorption intensity: The absorption intensity is not explicitly stated in the paragraph, but it can be inferred from the context that it may vary with temperature and solvent type.
13. Solvent type: The solvent type is mentioned as chloroform, toluene, chlorobenzene, and dichlorobenzene.

Therefore, the values in the paragraph are:

* Td: >350°C
* Mw, Mn: g/mol
* PDI: dimensionless
* Flow rate: mL/min
* Column set dimensions: mm
* Temperature (T): °C
* Absorption peaks in thin films: nm
* Absorption peaks in solution: nm
* Size of alkyl side chains (n): numerical value
* Absorption band locations: nm
* Ramp rate for TGA: °C/min
* Solvent type: chloroform, toluene, chlorobenzene, dichlorobenzene.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

* Td: >350°C (decomposition temperature)
* Mw, Mn: g/mol (molecular weight)
* PDI: dimensionless (polydispersity index)
* Absorption peaks in thin films: ∼ 430 nm, ∼ 620 nm, ∼ 680 nm
* Absorption peaks in solution: 380-420 nm, 520-560 nm, temperature-dependent
* Size of alkyl side chains (n): numerical value (10, 12, 14, or 16)
* Absorption band locations: π-π* transitions (high energy region), ∼ 560 nm, ∼ 680 nm
* Ramp rate for TGA: 40 °C/min

These are the material properties mentioned in the paragraph with their corresponding values.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property          | Value                                                         |
|------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
| Decomposition temperature (Td) | Higher than 350 °C                                          |
| Molecular weight (Mw, Mn)   | Determined by gel permeation chromatography, g/mol           |
| Polydispersity index (PDI)  | Calculated from Mw/Mn, dimensionless                         |
| Absorption peaks in thin films | ∼ 430 nm, ∼ 620 nm, ∼ 680 nm                          |
| Absorption peaks in solution | 380-420 nm, 520-560 nm, temperature-dependent               |
| Size of alkyl side chains (n) | Numerical value (10, 12, 14, or 16)                       |
| Absorption band locations | π-π* transitions (high energy region), ∼ 560 nm, ∼ 680 nm |
| Ramp rate for TGA          | 40 °C/min                                                  |
